intro: Viburnum opulus f. flavum, commonly known as the flowering dogwood or white-flowered guelder rose, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its showy, white, flat-topped flower clusters that appear in early spring. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that turn red in the fall, adding ornamental value. It typically grows to a height of 2–4 meters and prefers moist, well-drained soils. Viburnum opulus f. flavum is often used in gardens for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to cultivate.
